text: Far Eastern Republic (; romanised: Dalnevostochnaya Respublika, DVR), sometimes called the Chita Republic, was a nominally independent state established at Blagoveshchensk, covering the former Russian Far East and Siberia east of Lake Baikal on April 6, 1920. Category:1922 disestablishments Category:1920 establishments in Asia Category:1920s disestablishments in Asia Category:Puppet states Category:Former socialist republics Category:Former dictatorships
title: Far Eastern Republic
